page.title: 07CONSERVATION ,DUNTISBOURNE
page.content: The area is designated AONB (an area of outstanding natural beauty) by the Cotswold District Council.They are trying to protect landscape,valleys, flora ,fauna, and buildings.New buildings are strictly limited . Most of the older cottages are worthy of listing. Some have characteristic features such as the steep ,stone- tiled roof,dripping stones over doorways and windows.one has a thatched roof,others the typical stone window frames. In Leer the scenery is remarkable with the river crossing and re-crossing the road.Flowers such as willow herb,old man's beard ,knapweed as well as ash and hazel trees can be found there.Farmers are key figures in protecting wildlife following their natural instincts and sporing interests in the area.
